1.q_string: Which of the following graphs represents an impossible situation?

q_option: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true and Statement - 2 is the correct explanation for Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true, but Statement - 2 is NOT the correct explanation for Statement - 1.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement - 1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement - 2 (Reason). The question has the following four options, out of which only one choice is correct.

Statement - 1: The maximum range on an inclined plane when a body is projected upwards from the base of the plane is less than that when it is projected downwards from the top of the same plane with the same speed.

Statement - 2: The maximum range along an inclined plane is independent of the angle of inclination of the plane.
Three forces acting on a body are shown in fig. To have the resultant force only along the \(y\)-direction, the magnitude of the minimum additional force needed along \(OX\) is:

A particle moves in the \(x-y\) plane under the action of a force \(F\), such that the value of its linear momentum \(p\) at any time \(t\) is \(p_{x}=2 \cos t, p_{y}=2\) \(\sin t\). The angle between \(F\) and \(p\) at any given time \(t\) will be:
A particle is moving eastwards with a velocity of \(5~ms ^{-1}\). In \(10\) seconds, the velocity changes to \(5~ms ^{-1}\) northwards. The average acceleration in this time is:

A river is flowing from west to east with a speed of \(5~m\) \(min^{-1}\). A man can swim in still water with a velocity \(10~m\) \(min^{-1}\). In which direction should the man swim so as to take the shortest possible path to go to the south?

q_option: Their maximum height will be the same.
Their velocity at the highest point will be the same.
Their time of flight will be the same.
1.q_string: Two projectiles are fired from the same point with the same speed at angles of projection \(60^{\circ}\) and \(30^{\circ}\) respectively. Which one of the following is true?
If a particle is projected at an angle of \(45^{\circ}\), then find the relation between the range and the maximum height attained by the particle.

A cannon on the level plane is aimed at an angle \(\theta\) above the horizontal and a shell is fired with a muzzle velocity \(v _{0}\) towards the vertical cliff at a distance \(R\) away. The height from the bottom at which the shell strikes the side walls of the cliff is:

A ball is projected upwards from the top of a tower with a velocity of \(50~m / s\) making an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal. The height of the tower is \(70~m\). After how many seconds from the instant of throwing will the ball reach the ground?
If a line makes angles of \(30^{\circ}\) and \(45^{\circ}\) with \(x\)-axis and \(y\)-axis, then the angle made by it with \(z\)-axis is:
The maximum number of vectors of unequal magnitudes required to produce a zero resultant is:

q_option: are not equal to each other in magnitude.
are equal to each other in magnitude.

The basic difference between a scalar and vector is one of:

q_option: is equal to the path length of the particle between two points.
is less than the path length of the particle between two points.
is either less or equal to the path length of the particle between two points.
is more than the path length of the particle between two points.
1.q_string: Magnitude of displacement of a particle is:

q_option: the magnitude is the same for both.
the magnitude and direction are the same for both.
the direction is the same for both.
1.q_string: Two vectors are equal if:

q_option: gives a scalar that is \(\lambda\) times the magnitude of \(\vec{v}\).
gives a scalar that is \(\lambda\) times the polar angle of \(\vec{v}\).
gives a vector \(\overrightarrow{v^{\prime}}=\lambda \vec{v}\) in a direction opposite to \(\vec{v}\).
gives a vector \(\overrightarrow{v^{\prime}}=\lambda \vec{v}\) in the same direction as \(\vec{v}\).
